result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dakota Lee Potack

defendant.name: Potack, Dakota Lee
defendant.address: 12302 W County Road CC, Couderay, WI 54828

records.addlTxt:
1:02 PM Defendant Dakota Lee Potack in court.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Dakota Lee Potack.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Taber indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, Sawyer County Deputy Court Officer Ripczinski , sworn in by court.  State begins examination.  1:04 PM  Attny Taber Objection, Personal knowledge. Court indicates objection noted.  Court requests State continue.  1:04 PM  Attny Taber objection, leading.  Court makes statement to State.  Court objection noted.   Court requests State continue.   1:08 PM Witness identified the DEF,  Court indicates the record will reflect.  State tenders the witness.  1:09 PM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Taber.  1:09 PM  State objection,  objection withdrawn.  Cross-Examination continues.   1:10 PM  Attny Taber no further questions.  1;10 PM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.  State no argument.  Attny Taber no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
11:40 AM Defendant Dakota Lee Potack appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Dakota Lee Potack. Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and updates address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court enters NG Plea to Count 3.  Attny Taber request bond modification.  State makes objection.  Attny Taber continues argument.  Court modifies bond  CBS $500  No Contact with C.A.J.G.  dob: 3/10/2007.   Attorney Taber indicates DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing, DEF agrees.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 11:11 AM  Defendant Dakota L. Potack in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt (special appearance) appears by video.  Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does not qualify for public defender, but conflict with local office.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt argues bond.  Court sets bond.  CBS $2500 No Contact with C.A.J.G.  dob: 3/10/2007   Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for June 27, 2022 at 11:45 AM.
